identity.name: Walmart Inc.
identity.description: Walmart Inc. is a multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores. It is known for offering a wide variety of products at low prices, serving millions of customers worldwide.

products.name: Walmart Grocery
products.description: Walmart Grocery offers a wide selection of fresh produce, meat, dairy, and pantry staples, allowing customers to shop for groceries in-store or online with delivery options.

products.name: Walmart Supercenter
products.description: Walmart Supercenters combine a full grocery store with a general merchandise store, providing customers with a one-stop shopping experience for food, clothing, electronics, and household goods.

products.name: Walmart Pharmacy
products.description: Walmart Pharmacy provides prescription medications, over-the-counter drugs, and health consultations, making healthcare accessible and affordable for customers.

products.name: Walmart.com
products.description: Walmart's online platform allows customers to shop for a vast array of products, including electronics, home goods, and clothing, with options for home delivery or in-store pickup.

products.name: Walmart Financial Services
products.description: Walmart Financial Services offers a range of financial products, including money transfers, check cashing, and prepaid debit cards, aimed at providing affordable financial solutions to customers.

products.name: Walmart Apparel
products.description: Walmart Apparel features a wide range of clothing options for men, women, and children, focusing on affordability and style for everyday wear.

competitors.name: Target Corporation
competitors.description: Target is a general merchandise retailer that offers a wide range of products, including groceries, clothing, electronics, and home goods, with a focus on style and quality.
competitors.advantages: Target's emphasis on trendy merchandise and customer experience provides a competitive edge over Walmart's more utilitarian approach.

competitors.name: Costco Wholesale Corporation
competitors.description: Costco operates a chain of membership-only warehouse clubs, offering a wide variety of products at discounted prices, including bulk groceries and household goods.
competitors.advantages: Costco's membership model and bulk purchasing options allow for lower prices, appealing to budget-conscious consumers.

competitors.name: Amazon.com, Inc.
competitors.description: Amazon is a leading e-commerce platform that offers a vast selection of products, including books, electronics, and groceries, with a focus on convenience and fast delivery.
competitors.advantages: Amazon's advanced logistics and Prime membership program provide a competitive advantage in online shopping and delivery speed.

competitors.name: Aldi
competitors.description: Aldi is a global discount supermarket chain known for its low prices and no-frills shopping experience, offering a limited selection of private-label products.
competitors.advantages: Aldi's focus on cost-cutting and efficiency allows it to offer lower prices than Walmart on many grocery items.
